channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti, 3rd February
item.description:
Graffiti on lamppost 146F4 on 'cow path'

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Very deep pothole, 3rd February
item.description:
Very deep pothole on the northbound carriage way just beyond a bus stop and on the far side of a “hump” in the road. It is impossible to see it as you approach as it’s beyond the hump. In addition it is filled with rain water. It’s so deep that the wheel crashed into the edge. As I drove into it at night I couldn’t take a photo.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baring Road, Chinbrook, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish dumped incorrectly- Health Hazard, 3rd February
item.description:
Rubbish has been dumped and a pillow has been dumped in the yellow bin. This has been like this for weeks. The residents are now dumping rubbish on the floor and the foxes have now ripped the bags and this is all over the green on the grass and over the payment. So it’s a health hazard. It is not acceptable. They need to be told not to put the rubbish on the floor. It is the block of flats on the corner from the alley way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19-26, Batchwood Green, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This road is constantly flooding when it rains, 3rd February
item.description:
Pedestrians are constantly getting sprayed with water and it makes it difficult to cross the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince of Wales Drive, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The parking bay is very dangerous, 3rd February
item.description:
My other half and i were walking back to our car and when she stepped off the curb she twisted her ankle falling down the pothole, luckily i was in front of her and held her up or she would have fallen face first into the road. She then had to go to the hospital because she was in so much pain. This is unacceptable and needs to be dealt with before some old person is seriously injured.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 275, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, Erith, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

It is just front of the estate front door 2 drains have been blocked Please unblock them it cause problem whover uses the pavment or the front door entrance

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can of blue paint dumped and tipped over who’s has split all over the payment, 3rd February
item.description:
A full can of blue paint has been dumped on its side on the pavement and the rain is now washing it further down the pavement and it is making a big mess across the pavement and the road. The paint is also being trodden up and down the pavement and causing a real mess. This is located at Squire House outside the front of the Orchard Hill College/ Workstart unit in the corner next to the wall bordering bus station. Please can someone urgently remove the paint can to prevent it causing any further mess and also clean the split paint from the pavement?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Belvard Point, 17 Murray Street, NW 1 9RE, 3rd February
item.description:
The street light at this location has not been working for some time. Murray Street is mostly traffic free and is very dark at night. This is a safety issue that needs to be considered as a priority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Street, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac disintegrated around two manhole covers, 3rd February
item.description:
The road around two manhole covers in front of houses 41 and 44 Cranmore Road has broken up resulting in large potholes surrounding the covers. They are loose covers may not be getting the support required from the road around them and there are several renovations in the road at present meaning ladened skip lorries, scaffolding lorries and hardcore/sand deliveries HGV’s are running over them daily.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cranmore Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
